title: Merge torch.cuda.FloatTensor with torch.FloatTensor(with is_cuda==True)
body_html:
• OS: Linux 4.4.0-109-generic #132-Ubuntu SMP
  • PyTorch version: '0.3.0.post4'
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
  • Python version: Python 2.7.11 |Anaconda custom (64-bit)
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0
  • GPU models and configuration: GeForce GTX 1080
  • GCC version (if compiling from source):

Why are there two versions of Tensor in cuda? One is torch.cuda.FloatTensor, and the other is torch.FloatTensor (with is_cuda==True)?
Should we merge them?

body:
- OS: Linux 4.4.0-109-generic #132-Ubuntu SMP 
- PyTorch version: '0.3.0.post4'
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
- Python version: Python 2.7.11 |Anaconda custom (64-bit)
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 8.0
- GPU models and configuration: GeForce GTX 1080
- GCC version (if compiling from source):

Why are there two versions of Tensor in cuda? One is `torch.cuda.FloatTensor`, and the other is `torch.FloatTensor` (with `is_cuda==True`)?
Should we merge them?
